member.name: M:Lumia.Sense.StepCounter.GetStepCountAtAsync(Windows.Foundation.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the step count at given time.
member.remarks: The available data extends only up to the last 10 days. Please note that this method only returns data from history which is recorded at five minute intervals. Therefore the data can be up to five minutes old. If you need to get the current reading, use .
member.param: time to get the step count for
member.returns: Step count at the given time
member.exception: All errors are thrown as instances of . To get details about the error pass the property of the exception to . This method can return the following enumeration values: , , , , ,

member.name: M:Lumia.Sense.StepCounter.GetStepCountHistoryAsync(Windows.Foundation.DateTime,Windows.Foundation.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Returns time ordered list of step counts during given time period. Data granularity is usually around five minutes.
member.returns: Step count history
member.exception: All errors are thrown as instances of . To get details about the error pass the property of the exception to . This method can return the following enumeration values: , , , ,
member.remarks: The available data extends only up to the last 10 days. Please note that this method only returns data from history which is recorded at five minute intervals. Therefore the data can be up to five minutes old. If you need to get the current reading, use . If direct match is not available the result list begins with the last entry before the beginning of the given period. This enables an application to determine the step count at the start of the period before the first actual event within that period.

member.name: M:Lumia.Sense.StepCounter.GetCurrentReadingAsync
member.summary: Gets the current reading.
member.returns: The current reading of the sensor.
member.exception: All errors are thrown as instances of . To get details about the error pass the property of the exception to . This method can return the following enumeration values: , . ,
member.remarks: The return value may be null in case reading cannot be obtained currently.

StepCounter stepCounter = await StepCounter.GetDefaultAsync();

member.name: T:Lumia.Sense.PlaceMonitor
member.summary: Represents a monitor that identifies and maintains a list of geographic places frequently visited by the device.
member.remarks: This entity monitors several primitive sensor values, such as the device's geographic location, to identify a geographic location visited frequently. The most frequented places are then classified using various heuristics into a kind of a place. The classification is best effort and should not be expected to yield full accuracy in all styles of device usage. An application can and should implement a mapping from this pre-defined classification of places into concepts and visuals releavant in the application context.

member.name: M:HandleStandardErrors(System.Int32!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsLong)
member.summary: Handles standard errors received from Sense service. Will throw appropriate exceptions on errors.
member.remarks: This method will throw an exception whenever the status is not S_OK so be sure to handle custom errors codes prior to calling this method if you don't want a generic error exception to be thrown.

The most frequented places are then classified using various heuristics into a kind of a place. member.summary: Returns time ordered list of activities occured during given time period.
member.returns: Activity history
member.exception: All errors are thrown as instances of . To get details about the error pass the property of the exception to . This method can return the following enumeration values: , , , ,
member.remarks: The available data extends only up to the last 10 days. The returned list includes all activity monitor readings within the given time pediod. If available, the result list begins with the last entry before the beginning of the given period. This enables an application to determine the activity state of the device at the start of the period before the first actual activity event within that period.

member.name: P:Lumia.Sense.IActivityMonitor.Enabled
member.summary: Enables or disables activity change event monitoring.
member.remarks: events occur only while the property is set to true. However, sensor's current value can be queried via even when the property is false.

member.name: E:Lumia.Sense.IActivityMonitor.ReadingChanged
member.summary: Occurs each time activity changes.
member.remarks: An application may register a handler for this event to be notified of activity changes as an alternative to actively polling the values using .

member.name: T:Lumia.Sense.ActivityReadingChangedEventHandler
member.summary: Delegate type the ReadingChanged event handler of ActivityMonitor.

members.member:
Forward declaration for Activity monitor
Represents an activity state monitor sensor.
This sensor returns the user's activity state values derived from various sources of sensor and contextual information within the device.
The following example shows how to get the ActivityMonitor and use it to get current activity.
ActivityMonitor activityMonitor = await ActivityMonitor.GetDefaultAsync(); ActivityMonitorReading reading = await activityMonitor.GetCurrentReadingAsync();

member.name: M:Lumia.Sense.ActivityMonitorReading.#ctor(Lumia.Sense.Activity,Windows.Foundation.DateTime)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: P:Lumia.Sense.ActivityMonitorReading.Timestamp
member.summary: Gets the time at which the sensor reported the reading.
member.remarks: As the activity mode is derived computationally from other available information, the value does not correspond clearly to a concrete event in the physical world. Instead, it reflects the point in time when the underlying algorithm determined that the activity mode changed.

member.name: P:Lumia.Sense.ActivityMonitorReading.Mode
member.summary: Gets the activity.

member.name: T:Lumia.Sense.ActivityMonitorReading
member.summary: Supported device placements.
member.remarks: The device placement detection may be included as an additional information with activity detection notifications.
member.summary: Represents a reading of the ActivityMonitor.

member.name: T:Lumia.Sense.ITrackPointMonitor
member.summary: Represents a monitor that identifies and maintains a list of geographic places visited by the device.
member.remarks: Track points are collected passively, i.e. it won't actively track user's location with GPS, accuracy of track points reflects the used positioning technology.

member.summary: Returns the track point of the device at given time.
member.returns: Device location at given time
member.exception: All errors are thrown as instances of . To get details about the error pass the property of the exception to . This method can return the following enumeration values: , , , , ,
member.remarks: The available data extends only up to last 10 days. The return value is null in case track point is not available for the given time.

member.name: T:Lumia.Sense.TrackPointMonitor
member.summary: Represents a monitor that identifies and maintains a list of geographic places visited by the device.
member.remarks: Track points are collected passively, i.e. it won't actively track user's location with GPS, accuracy of track points reflects the used positioning technology.

member.name: M:Lumia.Sense.ActivityMonitor.GetActivityAtAsync(Windows.Foundation.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the device activity at given time.
member.returns: Activity at given time
member.exception: All errors are thrown as instances of . To get details about the error pass the property of the exception to . This method can return the following enumeration values: , , , , ,
member.remarks: The available data extends only up to the last 10 days.

member.name: M:Lumia.Sense.ActivityMonitor.GetActivityHistoryAsync(Windows.Foundation.DateTime,Windows.Foundation.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Returns time ordered list of activities occured during given time period.
member.returns: Activity history
member.exception: All errors are thrown as instances of . To get details about the error pass the property of the exception to . This method can return the following enumeration values: , , , ,
member.remarks: The available data extends only up to the last 10 days. The returned list includes all activity monitor readings within the given time pediod. If available, the result list begins with the last entry before the beginning of the given period. This enables an application to determine the activity state of the device at the start of the period before the first actual activity event within that period.

member.name: M:Lumia.Sense.ActivityMonitor.GetCurrentReadingAsync
member.summary: Gets the current activity
member.returns: Current activity
member.exception: All errors are thrown as instances of . To get details about the error pass the property of the exception to . This method can return the following enumeration values: , , ,
member.remarks: The return value may be null in case reading cannot be obtained.

member.name: P:Lumia.Sense.ActivityMonitor.Enabled
member.summary: Enables or disables activity change event monitoring.
member.remarks: events occur only while the property is set to true. However, sensor's current value can be queried via even when the property is false.

member.name: E:Lumia.Sense.ActivityMonitor.ReadingChanged
member.summary: Occurs each time activity changes.
member.remarks: An application may register a handler for this event to be notified of activity changes as an alternative to actively polling the values using .

member.name: T:Lumia.Sense.ActivityMonitor
member.summary: Represents an activity state monitor sensor.
member.remarks: This sensor returns the user's activity state values derived from various sources of sensor and contextual information within the device.
